document.title: Faith Formation (Religion) Curriculum Framework Standards and Benchmarks: Grade 8

47BFC590DCF84165801BD98A4BD94490.description: Students will know that we can know God through his creation.

E62188B2DDE141938C5C54A5DCEA2B66.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the importance of care for God’s creation.

F0883A783ADF4F629912DA20800EC841.description: Students will know that when one member of the Body of Christ suffers, all suffer.

A355BF971273410A9F18EEEC8F153779.description: Students will know the meaning of social sin.

F92B8C99E9204183BCBAA2BA7571974C.description: Students will know that preserving the common good requires that ‘aggressors’ are unable to inflict harm.

C25ACABBEEA9422DB9F6D5474FAAE8D9.description: Students will grow in their understanding of solidarity.

A2FF5CBBA6C8437DAAD78AE85A2298A2.description: Students will know what it means to respect the basic rights of others.

3A8A3CA695C04259A5C525C14C99EC5A.description: Students will know that every person has a right to private property.

A4CD695934234315A8B3492F4F57B0E8.description: Students will know that the Church teaches that everyone is entitled to a just wage and benefits.

8749CC4A4BC5495D838F89567C0FC6DD.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the dignity of the work and the rights of others.

B5BF5598B7854F11A71C2CD8352E01C0.description: Students will know that the seventh commandment teaches that we are called to show a preferential love of the poor.

2BF985BD4B624798A6D21C41E6CE5DFB.description: Students will know, identify and recognize the needs of the poor and vulnerable in their communities and in the world.

DC8663CC64D64FD4BE84C21516611E5E.description: Students will know that we sanctify the Lord’s day by celebrating the Eucharist and visiting the sick and helping the poor.

34301AD503B944A2B338F9C795544556.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the preferential option for the poor and vulnerable.

DFAFA8957F9C4D44AD646752ED7ACBA0.description: Students will know that they are responsible to one another, their families and to society at large.

762193A6BAE545AAADB545628861AE66.description: Students will know that the common good is achieved through the protection of the rights of others.

313833A427F449F19FC5212A69BF6470.description: Students will know that our attitudes toward our neighbor reflect our acceptance or refusal of grace.

C06FDAF112B34E3B8D4DDBF8E9DDFFC1.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the rights of all people and their responsibilities towards others.

3E621912849B4C8B83074F41B52447E1.description: Students will know that the family is the original cell of social life.

A5863A65450E4280936CAF33907146B5.description: Students will know that Catholics are not just individualists, but are committed to the common good.

CCA35CBBA25F4EC690D5386F767E69C3.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the call to family, community and participation in society.

5C38C8364D984D8E9D2763D01D66C648.description: Students will know the importance of the dignity of human sexuality.

DC4EDA11EB144CEEB9668B5F8793AE21.description: Students will know that Catholics are called to foster dignity, prosperity and peace for all.

32D0DB30B849476294A8B69007CAD3EA.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the life and dignity of the human person.

A7D6E2F7021048CA9E215AC6D3277CEB.description: Students will know the major themes of Catholic social teaching.

D1DECFD8B8014318A3E78A1278379881.description: Students will know that the natural law is written on the hearts of each person and forms the basis for a just society.

7CE97527F51E4C0695FCF8022700CA6E.description: Students will grow in their understanding of justice and service.

C2D9C6B7A0A640EA91D8601F14DE96A3.description: Students will know that the fourth commandment provides the foundation for the Church’s social doctrine.

4C02ACD6D0094125BF891BA78AF07B9D.description: Students will know that social situations are improved by conversion of heart and then by changing the unjust situation.

55EE6607B529434BAA5DED559BCD6258.description: Students will grow in their knowledge of Catholic social teaching.

0B059B996F3C49169FD267B21D5CE733.description: Students will know specific ways that they can do evangelization in the Church.

A9BC6336EC7B4F729B19D03F84F2BAE0.description: Students will know that in her ministries, the Church has always showed a preferential love of the poor.

7526687DB9D047B0837E44379746E7AC.description: Students will grow in their understanding of participation in the ministry of the Church.

009DE8F54B3440CBBD65714EFF7830BD.description: Students will know that the pope and bishops normally teach on moral matters by catechesis and preaching.

9B03370BA74E430C8352AEF03A68C407.description: Students will know that the pope and the bishops in communion make up the Magisterium of the Church.

B54CDF2CA3DE483D83ED86C277B87C22.description: Students will know that the bishops form a college of which the pope is the head.

76801611EFE54D1A883B256E0BF7F8B0.description: Students will grow in their understanding of Church life at parish, diocesan and universal levels.

C66D4262D6F14C94A8C923D75DCC3F2B.description: Students will know that ongoing faith formation leads us to share more deeply in the life of the Trinity.

D14ED358C6334E9FBD7EB827394E266D.description: Students will know that catechesis aims to put people in communion with Jesus Christ.

059B0C07D6C94CDEAEE01042B5B07D78.description: Students will grow in their understanding of participation in life-long faith formation.

6B59E04261204C89B4CBA59B201182D7.description: Students will know that full, conscious and active participation in the Eucharist includes their participation in responses, songs, prayers, silence and gestures.

64937900367B4F32989DBF323DF150DC.description: Students will know that Christ is present in the gathering of the faithful on Sunday.

E59B759100F3493F9A269FF642EE2742.description: Students will grow in their understanding of participation in the liturgical life of the Church.

FA53A460F7AF4CEABB24A62D23492CCF.description: Students will know the precepts of the Church and be able to apply them to their daily lives.

8A01F487429F40C686B5FA3BC623B9A8.description: Students will know that Church law teaches that we do not miss Mass on Sunday and Holy Days of Obligation.

62F65FBE4C0B440F87DFD3DE7F8416E7.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Church Law.

256B39BA8BB54C2CBA05BC5C8CCD9385.description: Students will know that God always forgives us.

BD652E328EA34BEA946CF036F0B80DE5.description: Students will know that some acts are always wrong.

3ACC998231A642D0BC92AD72031A9D56.description: Students will know that the power to forgive sins is a great gift of Christ to the Church.

DB03753BB47348979477CB88A4C53880.description: Students will know that sin upsets our relationship with God.

80B9DEE57B0B47C480D8BE2939DEDBA8.description: Students will know that original sin is a deprivation of original holiness and justice.

D2942A9ABA904C9D8CEAB3C383413B57.description: Students will grow in their understanding of Sin and Forgiveness.

986EE61C4ECF407A9201190E3E7D105D.description: Students will know that without a sense of sin and an awareness of God’s love, it is impossible to find conversion and forgiveness.

FC0D1F67FC704CCE85D4F781ED2149B4.description: Students will know that our conscience is a judgment of reason that helps us to recognize the moral quality of each action.

480D18D5D5224BF2831E47F200E0AB89.description: Students will know that our conscience leads us to know and long for God.

D68A356F8F9348DFB6A82BE97BBB8BA4.description: Students will grow in their understanding of Conscience.

5005F383D5B84594BD79709CA60D0A74.description: Students will know that the tenth commandment teaches that we live for the kingdom of heaven and should be detached from material things.

8EA1F40731E64D4DB72B9DCA78DDDE24.description: Students will know that the ninth commandment teaches that the Good News of Jesus Christ should renew culture.

E4228096D8C94355BBDDEE544634C28E.description: Students will know that the eighth commandment teaches that we are to keep personal confidences.

8FCA2763C7FD4EC48A7512126DB56BA1.description: Students will know that the seventh commandment teaches that we are called to show a preferential love of the poor.

133E9F0F9E03401AA38FD28466908B05.description: Students will know that discrimination against homosexual persons should be avoided.

17A731B5C97B45EBA67D1E298373B1FB.description: Students will know that the sixth commandment teaches that homosexual acts [not tendencies] are gravely sinful.

83F3D58F186F44F4B9388FD0EB11F31B.description: Students will know that the fifth commandment teaches that human life can never be deliberately taken.

E56A0B0569424272B284F7C8261C4A91.description: Students will know that parents must respect their children’s vocation.

729EF586E73546988120EF243B7A72C7.description: Students will know that the fourth commandment provides the foundation for the Church’s social doctrine.

D74C1C3C44BF4642A75E4BFF5D8A7EC3.description: Students will know that we sanctify the Lord’s Day by celebrating the Eucharist, visiting the sick and helping the poor.

EF9C1F009D8444D1BECA2A45F88AA424.description: Students will know that indifference and or hatred of God is opposed to the first commandment.

E5CB0DDD3CCB4929993D4B2322132005.description: Students will know that we are meant to love God beyond all things.

9F4A9EB3A9924BB1AFFECB80F71A53C3.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Commandments.

AF6EC2316D1D47A78C4683DCA4DA68C9.description: Students will know concrete ways to live out the Beatitudes in their daily living.

8E0CEAEC79014E90B366547E45D425B5.description: Students will know that the Beatitudes are the heart of Christian teaching.

B7A1950EC169485D8CECEADF2F36AC84.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Beatitudes.

625823D14E634493AE91F12EF87B6B3D.description: Students will know that freedom is not just doing what we want, but that we become free when we do good.

598940FF08CE49FBAE4D3C9079C34D94.description: Students will know that rejection of God’s grace and love can lead to our condemnation.

9A6DC4F6FFEA44438DB70912D3BC2DEC.description: Students will know that our attitudes toward our neighbor reflect our acceptance or refusal of grace.

6815387EC99E4B93AADD4EE867890486.description: Students will know the great commandment to love God and others.

B3C1EDB2B2C74F38B13FAE1041E60378.description: Students will grow in their understanding of Life in Christ.

8E17C500F895418D8D7ADE61A4147E85.description: Students will know each part of the Lord’s Prayer and its meaning for their lives.

0667B15A016B4AB9B0BE09BCF51AE6CE.description: Students will know that the Lord’s Prayer is the most perfect of prayers.

EE22BC9E2B9C45F6ABB12EF8A188A25B.description: Students will know the Nicene Creed which comes from the Council of Nicea.

4ADBEF299CE54945824538E46D7D8D4B.description: Students will grow in their understanding of prayer.

A7C67CF0FAF34471A2C2E19DAC29B443.description: Students will know the many forms of blessings of the Church and become familiar with the blessings that can be used in the domestic church [the home].

AC532CAC99FF4CEAAF2BDC67F1296E64.description: Students will know the difference between liturgical prayer and devotional prayer.

23C7DE9AF1B94F8A88CE39AA56C80FB9.description: Students will know how to prepare and lead Morning and Evening prayer.

EE6019D42B9E4FD2AD7A7E7193ADF8C4.description: Students will grow in their understanding of other Liturgical celebrations.

6F07DF4C8C2B4CC3BA196E826E74F811.description: Students will know that in the course of one liturgical year the whole mystery of Christ is unfolded.

6FAE82CC8A36499FBF42ADCB0BEB8B9A.description: Students will know that Christmas makes present the Savior in our world today.

10D293DC9F9044F8A951F2861C9E355A.description: Students will know that the Christmas season celebrates the reality of the Incarnation.

BB1F3F199F49446E8631636244139984.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Liturgical Year.

C751C8698E4D4506A152CD40534A8D08.description: Students will know that an annulment means that a sacramental marriage did not exist and that those who remarry without one cannot receive communion.

3D2816E9D3594DF1ADDB1F24C1F8E799.description: Students will know that Jesus taught that marriage is permanent.

AE15EB21AD87419480A8BCA43FB4D0E0.description: Students will know that the priesthood reaches its high point in the celebration of the Eucharist.

8F905D42AD2B44DB9D62A8DFCAE173AB.description: Students will know that priests are ordained to serve as co-workers with the bishop in serving the community.

623B4BC0E2B7445A9FDD715F2C479E68.description: Students will know that the anointing of the sick can heal physically as well as spiritually.

9A566983ED724998A10570001D105CD9.description: Students will know that the anointing of the sick can be received each time one becomes seriously ill.

F74AFF58A87C4F6C948D51DED9F9C03D.description: Students will know that the proper time for the anointing of the sick is serious illness or old age.

F001C9ED9802486C9D2DEBB8DEAA6760.description: Students will know that the individual confession of sins is the ordinary means of reconciliation with God and with the Church.

E80D8A1C15ED4A7D98E8A2BF488BDBC8.description: Students will know that the substance of bread and wine is transformed into the substance of the Body and Blood of Christ. This is called transubstantiation.

AEC308618C564B2E8C6B150C45767D1D.description: Students will know that the Eucharist recalls Christ’s Passover and at the same time makes it present.

4A3532D66DFE4FE1B463B96B5A49ED7E.description: Students will know that the Eucharist is thanksgiving to God the Father for all creation.

3F0F95C6F4F943E6A2DDA40F488FF029.description: Students will know that Christian maturity in reference to Confirmation does not refer to age, but rather to one’s growth in Baptism.

8908B1C65D614CE78E70D99D51F70792.description: Students will know that when we celebrate the Eucharist we are united with the Communion of Saints.

D75B589D286248BDA5CA174A8E1F5147.description: Students will know the sacraments of initiation: Baptism, Confirmation and Eucharist.

7A43667DF7F545199F87FCF62321C769.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Sacraments.

4946632C69344673AA8FFCD4A5701E55.description: Students will know that in the liturgical celebration we are joined to the heavenly celebration.

A1A081AF5F844928B8CAB008E7A3CB27.description: Students will know that the liturgical services are not private functions but celebrations that belong to the Church.

E67CCCFE1500497B9C0A9DF8F87E996A.description: Students will know that the liturgy not only recalls saving events, but makes them present in each celebration.

0210772950444D02A8A105B219A04EF2.description: Students will know that Christ is present in the assembly, the Word, the presiding celebrant, and in his Body and Blood.

047FAA181A4B4CBFA02F2AE1470FA23F.description: Students will know that the Nicene Creed is prayed at Sunday Mass in the United States.

427B8A1645C94062ACF0473C49381F34.description: Students will know that we truly encounter Christ in every sacramental liturgy.

172393C866F04E52B038A4369A124D8F.description: Students will know that the Paschal Mystery is present and celebrated in the liturgy.

0E9C8669A84D4287BF7E666E1F69DEA3.description: Students will grow in their understanding of Worship and prayer.

219150EFB9FD4153BB2CF092E2745E79.description: Students will know that Mary cooperated with Christ in the work of redemption.

EF0DA184A9BE4739B3E97F8CCD2AD71D.description: Students will know that Mary remained a virgin in conceiving her Son by the power of the Holy Spirit.

B3544A36ABE849288956B2DB0E0D901C.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Saints.

AAD497EB92204DEE8B5F7B19F9F06FDF.description: Students will know that in the Old Testament God was addressed as “Lord.”

381395BC695D461D821F376BD2E5F8D6.description: Students will know that scripture reveals that humans were created in a state of original holiness.

1EBA26D521564397A473EF88980AA7FD.description: Students will know that scripture is read within the living tradition of the Church.

19A5EA99B943405FBA821B44321D8A76.description: Students will know the literary forms used to understand scripture.

934A23E54D7F4F7E8842D4D060572A22.description: Students will know that the human writers of scripture are true authors.

BBA3D9D4736F4C0FA2506CE5FC5444F1.description: Students will know that Revelation is complete in Jesus Christ.

38363CFC833A415084A2A38E2DABD0DE.description: Students will grow in their understanding of Revelation.

D3C32B70586F41068CA6EEDA2D578C78.description: Students will know that we are to proclaim the Gospel to the world.

CD3AAD77C74143CAB855747AAF41BFEE.description: Students will know that the Catholic Church has the fullness of means of salvation but other Christians share elements of grace and truth.

EAAFC6BEF929443B842C4C2FCEEEBFDA.description: Students will know that all salvation comes from Christ through the Church.

6FF863873F154171A2341022AA656E06.description: Students will know that the Church has a hierarchical structure with the Pope as the head.

7B19F9A87F1F4469B69AFEBE5D966022.description: Students will know the images of Church: People of God, Body of Christ, Temple of the Holy Spirit, Communion.

B489BFDE585B4A3A8F1E954F07D3BA2B.description: Students will know that the Church is Trinitarian.

B542ECDD42154576B432F0C438DB5A4A.description: Students will know that Jesus founded the Church.

18DCDADB8E0F4C63A7BA4343E9943900.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Church.

D1048777B95D4C0598E503181857A3B1.description: Students will know that the Holy Spirit builds up the Church.

D6DC8E14CAFB4A6B9F340DE36723443F.description: Students will know that the Church is the sacrament of the Trinity.

BD803A4856434DDAB952468E2549E288.description: Students will know that the activities of the Son and the Spirit in salvation history are distinct but inseparable.

3BDF2BA31C184BF6857A41938D7CE0FA.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Holy Spirit.

219DE70C960D4F91BABDAFEAC78085E5.description: Students will know that Christ will come again to judge everyone according to their works.

45F92827D4A14A049EC8D5C03492DF3D.description: Students will know that Christ freely offered himself as the sacrifice of the New Covenant.

D1980381C1CD4CDDAAF9D5D2D174C745.description: Students will know that Christ’s redemption is a ransom from sin.

50088AD83A89496DA513BC24E8B806F2.description: Students will know that the Incarnation is the wonderful mystery of the union of the divine and human natures in the one person of the Word.

F3D66B533AFB496E9BA9089A01080896.description: Students will know that Jesus learned as we do.

6D94D6A19AF447FD8D991E54A7ED1A10.description: Students will know that Jesus Christ is not part God and part man but truly God and truly man.

66FE7092376140C1A04ACC860622AEC8.description: Students will grow in their understanding of God the Son.

BF72D0A78E04413798B3EABDFB637ECB.description: Students will know that the result of original sin is ignorance, suffering and death.

FEFDBEAFFEB1429C858980025361040E.description: Students will know that God created the human person as a union of body and soul.

EA31B54ED4DF4D98B138A506493AAA1D.description: Students will know that God’s love triumphs over all evil and pain.

043F96BE003E4DB8A599A1EB19081EEC.description: Students will know that God orders all things for good.

B3CDFE59A4734A8FA9F865744AD76D7D.description: Students will grow in their understanding of God the Father.

5C7E5FAE1DAD4430AB3570D6F1FAACD1.description: Students will know that the Kingdom of God comes in its fullness only in heaven, but we are called to bring about the kingdom here on earth.

4E48FCC7B6654575BB2623EEAD875BAF.description: Students will know that the Trinity is three persons, distinct from one another.

EFB0B2B1BF3A404C8204994D58B81574.description: Students will know that in the Trinity the Father is God, the Son is God, and the Holy Spirit is God.

7B8A3B64BB5B4D03B38C6BF746747D08.description: Students will know that faith is a gift that must always be nourished.

B2405119552847E1B69F331B7490CF56.description: Students will know that God has revealed his love to us by sending his Son and the Holy Spirit.

D417484690E24653951902115065E6EA.description: Students will grow in their understanding of the Triune God.
